page.title: 03A SMALL BUSINESS IN WESTON
page.content: NEXT TO OUR SCHOOL IS A BUILDING WHICH USED TO BE THE VILLAGE HALL.IT IS NOW USED BY A SMALL FIRM CALLED SPECIALISED ORTHOTIC SERVICES.THEY MAKE EQUIPMENT FOR THE PHYSICALLY HANDICAPPED AND THEIR MAIN OUTPUT IS INDIVIDUALLY MOULDED SEATING FOR CHILDREN IN SPECIAL SCHOOLS AND HOSPITALS.THEY EMPLOY FOUR FULL TIME WORKERS AND COVER A LARGE AREA IN THE CENTRE OF ENGLAND.IN GENERAL THE CHILDREN ARE VISITED IN THEIR SCHOOLS AND HOSPITALS AND MOULDED CASTS ARE MADE TO ENSURE A PERFECT FIT.THE SEATS ARE THEN CREATED IN THE FACTORY AT WESTON.THE BUSINESS EMPLOYS A FULL TIME ENGINEER AND IS EQUIPPED WITH HAND TOOLS AND SMALL MACHINES.THE BUSINESS IS EXPANDING AND THOSE INVOLVED FIND IT INTERESTING AND SATISFYING.THE SITE IS STILL USED AS A CAR PARK FOR THE 'NEW' VILLAGE HALL.
